This is statistically the biggest upset in European Championship history.
Since FIFA began its world rankings, no side has beaten an opponent as many places above it as Slovakia (48th) beating Belgium (second).
It's the biggest upset by FIFA ranking differential in Euro history, with Belgium ranked No. 3 and Slovakia ranked No. 48, a difference of 45 spots.
Ivan Schranz scored Slovakia's quickest goal at a major tournament.
Veterans Kucka and Peter Pekark have now started all eight games Slovakia has ever played in the European finals tournament since first qualifying for the 2016 edition.
